gurmukhi: mhw suMdR isAwmM mhwN AiBrwmM ]mhwN rUp rUpM mhwN kwm kwmM ]59]
transliteration: Mahaa Soundra Siaamannd Mahaan Abhiraamannd|| Mahaan Roop Roopan Mahaan Kaam Kaamannd||59||
translation: The most beautiful black colour highly fascinates the mind, Thou art the most beautiful of the beautiful once and the most passionate of he passionate once.59.

gurmukhi: iPrY ckR caudhUM purIAM miDAwxM ]ieso kOx bIAM iPrY AwieswxM ]
transliteration: Phirai Charka Chaudahoon Purooan Madhiaanan|| Iso Kaoun Booan Phirai Aaesaanan||
translation: The Order of KAL is prevalent in all the fourteen worlds. Who is the other one who hath the audacity to refuse His Order?

gurmukhi: kho kuMt kOnY ibKY Bwj bwcY ]sBM sIs ky sMg sRI kwl nwcY ]60]
transliteration: Kaho Kount Kaounai Bikhai Bikhai Bhaaj Baachai|| Sabhan Soos Ke San Sroo Kaal Naachai||60||
translation: Tell me, in which direction you can flee and remain safe? Since the KAL dances over the heads of all.60.

gurmukhi: kry kot koaU Dry kot EtM ]bcYgo n ikauhUM krY kwl cotM ]
transliteration: Dare Kot Ko( i)  Ddare Kot Otan|| Bachaigo Na Kiuhoon Darai Kaal Chotan||
translation: Through one may erect millions of forts and may remain under their protection, even then, in the case of a blow of KAL, he will not be saved in any way.

gurmukhi: ilKM jMqR kyqy pVHM mMqR kotM ]ibnw srn qwN kI nhI AOr EtM ]61]
transliteration: Likhanndjantra Kete Padhan Mantra Kotan|| Binaa Saran Taan Koo Nahoo Aur Otan||61||
translation: Though one may write many Yantras and recite millions of mantras, even then he cannot be saved. No other shelter can save one without His refuge.61.

gurmukhi: ilKM jMqR Qwky pVHM mMqR hwry ]kry kwl qy AMq lY kY ibcwry ]
transliteration: Likhanndjantra Thaake Padhan Mantra Hdare|| Dare Kaal Te Ant Lai Kai Bichdare||
translation: The writers of Yantras have grown weary and the reciters of mantras have accepted defeat. But ultimately, they all have been destroyed by KAL.

gurmukhi: ikiqE qMqR swDy ju jnmM ibqwieE ]Bey PoktM kwj eykY n AwieE ]62]
transliteration: Kitio Tantra Saadhe Ju Janamannd Bitaaio|| Bhae Phokatan Kaaj Ekai Na Aaio||62||
translation: Many Tantras have been tamed and in such endeavours one hath wasted his birth. All have become useless and none hath proved useful.62.

gurmukhi: ikqy nws mUMdy Bey bHmcwrI ]ikqy kMT kMTI jtw sIs DwrI ]
transliteration: Kite Naas Moondde Bhae Brahmchdaroo|| Kite Kanth Kanthoo Jataa Soos Dhdaroo||
translation: Many have become Brahmacharis and have closed their nostrils (in their process of contemplation). Many have worn Kanthi (necklace) on their necks and have matted hair on their heads.

gurmukhi: ikqy cIr kwnM jugIsM khwXM ]sBY PoktM Drm kwmM n AwXM ]63]
transliteration: Kite Choor Kaanan Jougoosan Kahaayan|| Sabhai Phokatan Dharam Daamannd Na Aayan||63||
translation: Many have got their ears perforated and caused others to call them great Yogis. All such religious observances were useless and none of them became useful.63.

gurmukhi: mDu kItBM rwCsysM blIAM ]smY AwpnI kwl qyaU dlIAM ]
transliteration: Madhu Kootabhan Raachhsesan Badooan|| Samai Aapnoo Kaal Teoo Dalooan||
translation: There had been mighty demon-kings like Madhu and Kaitabh, the KAL crushed them on their turn.

gurmukhi: Bey suMB nYsuMB sRoxMq bIjM ]qyaU kwl kIny pRyjM pRyjM ]64]
transliteration: Bhae Sounbh Naisounbh Sronant Boojan|| Teoo Kaal Koone Purejan Purejan||64||
translation: Then there were Sumbah, Nisumbh and Sranavat Beef. They were also chopped into bits by KAL.64.

gurmukhi: blI piRQIAM mwnDwqw mhIpM ]ijnY rQ c`kR kIey swq dIpM ]
transliteration: Badoo Prithooan Maandhaataa Mahoopan|| Jinai Rath Chakkra Kooe Saat Dipan||
translation: The mighty king Prithu and the great sovereign like Mandhata who had demarcated seven continents with his chariot-wheel.

gurmukhi: BujM BIm BrQM jgM jIiq fMfMXw ]iqnY AMq ky AMq kO kwl KMfMXw ]65]
transliteration: Bhujan Bhoom Bharathan Jagadg Jeet(i) Dandyan|| Tinai Ant Ke Ant Kau Kaal Khandyan||65||
translation: The king Bhim and the Bharat, who had conquered and brought the world under their control with the strength of arms. They were all destroyed by KAL, when they were nearing their end.65.

gurmukhi: ijnY dIp dIpM duhweI iPrweI ]Bujw dMf dY Coix C`qRM iCnweI ]
transliteration: Jinai Doop Doopan Duhaaoo Phiraaoo|| Bhujaa Dand Dai Chhodh(i) Chhattran Chhinaaoo||
translation: He, who hath created the frightening dominance of His Name. He, who had snatched the earth from the Kshatriyas with the strength of staff-like arms.
